amendment.description: To express the sense of the Senate that the United States should fully enforce existing sanctions, and should explore additional sanctions, with respect to North Korea and to require a review to determine whether North Korea should be re-listed as a state sponsor of terrorism.

vote.text: Amendment SA 1761 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 66 - 31. Record Vote Number: 238.

action.text: Amendment SA 1761 proposed by Senator Levin for Senator Kerry. (consideration: CR S7841-7846; text: CR S7841-7842) To express the sense of the Senate that the United States should fully enforce existing sanctions, and should explore additional sanctions, with respect to North Korea and to require a review to determine whether North Korea should be re-listed as a state sponsor of terrorism.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1761 proposed by Senator Levin for Senator Kerry.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 1761 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 66 - 31. Record Vote Number: 238.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 1761 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 66 - 31. Record Vote Number: 238.
